name: Operation Greens
description: Stabilizes supply and prices of tomato, onion & potato (TOP) through support to FPOs, logistics & processing.
benefits: Reduces price volatility and improves farmer returns.
eligibility: FPOs and food processors dealing with TOP crops

name: Atal Bhujal Yojana
description: Groundwater management scheme launched in 2019, active till 2025 across seven states to improve water sustainability.
benefits: Enhances groundwater recharge and efficient usage.
eligibility: Participating Gram Panchayats in priority states

name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi (PM‑KISAN)
description: Provides ₹6,000 per year in three installments to small and marginal land‑holding farmer families via direct benefit transfer.
benefits: Direct income support deposited into bank accounts.

name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)
description: Crop insurance scheme covering yield loss due to natural calamities, pests, and disease.
benefits: Compensation for insured crop losses.
eligibility: Farmers growing notified crops in notified areas

name: Soil Health Card Scheme
description: Issues soil health cards based on testing, with crop‑wise fertilizer recommendations.
benefits: Optimizes fertilizer usage and improves yield.

name: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana (PMKSY)
description: Promotes micro‑irrigation and efficient water use under ‘Per Drop More Crop’.
amount: Up to 70% subsidy on irrigation systems
benefits: Water conservation and yield improvement.

name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY)
description: Modernizes fisheries and aquaculture infrastructure across India.
benefits: Boosts fish productivity and exports.

name: Paramparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana (PKVY)
description: Cluster-based organic farming promotion with certification and training.
benefits: Premium pricing and chemical-free produce.

name: Agri Infrastructure Fund (AIF)
description: Offers concessional loans for setting up post‑harvest agribusiness infrastructure.
amount: Loans up to ₹2 crore/project + interest subvention
benefits: Reduces losses, improves value chains.

name: Pradhan Mantri Kisan Maandhan Yojana (PM‑KMY)
description: Pension scheme providing ₹3,000/month post-retirement for small/marginal farmers.
benefits: Old-age income security.

name: National Agriculture Market (e‑NAM)
description: Online trading platform connecting farmers and buyers across India for transparent pricing.
benefits: Better price discovery and reduced intermediaries.

name: Svamitva Yojana
description: Drone-based property survey initiative to map rural inhabited lands (abadi plots).
benefits: Helps resolve land disputes, improves credit access.

name: Rashtriya Krishi Vikas Yojana (RKVY)
description: Grant-based scheme to create agricultural infrastructure and boost agri‑entrepreneurship.
amount: Central and State grants for projects
benefits: Accelerates rural agri‑growth and infrastructure.

name: Krishi Samruddhi Yojana (Maharashtra)
description: State scheme launched from FY 2025‑26 with ₹5,000 crore/year support for sustainable farming.
benefits: Supports organic farming, mechanization and infrastructure.
eligibility: Women, SC/ST, small/marginal farmers, FPOs in Maharashtra

name: Millet Mission & Kiwi/Dragon Fruit Policy (Uttarakhand)
description: Cluster-based mission to support millets, kiwi, dragon fruit & apple post‑harvest in hilly areas.
benefits: Boosts horticulture in Uttarakhand hills.

name: Urea Subsidy Scheme
description: Central government pays subsidy to make urea available to farmers at affordable rates.
benefits: Lowers input costs for farmers.
eligibility: All farmers purchasing urea fertilizers in India

name: PM‑KUSUM Scheme
description: Solar irrigation and energy initiative providing subsidy on solar pumps and grid-connected solar plants.
benefits: Reduces diesel dependency, enables selling solar power.
eligibility: Willingness to install solar energy systems

name: Krishi Kalyan Abhiyan
description: Campaign providing farmer training, soil health cards, mini‑kits, livestock vaccinations across aspirational districts.
benefits: Promotes best farming practices and farmer education.

name: PM FME Scheme (Formalisation of Micro Food Processing Enterprises)
description: Provides financial, technical support and training to micro food processing units including farmer-families.
benefits: Promotes agri-processing and job creation.

name: National Bamboo Mission
description: Aims to develop bamboo sector across value chain including farmers and enterprises.
benefits: Promotes bamboo cultivation and livelihood.

name: Green Revolution – Krishonnati Yojana
description: Focuses on enhancing productivity of high-yielding seed varieties and value chains.
benefits: Enhances food production and exports.

name: PM-AASHA (Annadata Aay SanraksHan Abhiyan)
description: Ensures remunerative prices to farmers via MSP and procurement operations.
benefits: Reduces distress sales and stabilizes income.
eligibility: All farmers covered under MSP procurement

name: Rashtriya Gokul Mission
description: Conservation and development of indigenous bovine breeds to improve dairy farmer incomes.
benefits: Higher milk productivity and genetic quality.

name: National Food Security Mission (NFSM)
description: Enhances production of rice, wheat, pulses and coarse cereals via resource support and inputs.
amount: Input support to farmers for crop targets
benefits: Boosts national food stock and farmer incomes.

name: National Mission on Oilseeds & Oil Palm (NMOOP)
description: Promotes cultivation of oilseeds and palm to reduce import dependence.
benefits: Improved production and farmers’ profitability.

name: K-Kisan (Krishi Kalyan Portal)
description: Digital information portal for weather, market prices and agronomy advisory via SMS.
benefits: Real‑time advisories via mobile.

name: PM‑Kisan Maan‑Dhan Yojana (PM‑KMY)
description: Pension scheme offering ₹3,000/month for small/marginal famers after retirement.
benefits: Old‑age financial security.

name: Micro-Irrigation Fund (under AIF)
description: Dedicated fund under Agri Infra Fund to support micro-irrigation infrastructure.
amount: Interest subvention on loans for irrigation systems
benefits: Promotes water-efficient farming.
eligibility: All farmer groups under AIF support

name: PM FME Scheme
description: Financial and technical support for micro food processing enterprises created by farmers.
benefits: Boosts rural manufacturing and incomes.

name: AGMARKNET
description: Provides real-time market price information across regulated agricultural markets in India.
benefits: Enables informed price decisions.

name: National Mission on Natural Farming (NMNF)
description: Promotes chemical-free farming practices and organic certification.
benefits: Healthier soil and higher-value produce.

name: Krishi Samruddhi Yojana (Maharashtra)
description: State initiative with ₹5,000 crore yearly support for sustainable agriculture in Maharashtra.
benefits: Support for organic farming, mechanization, infrastructure.
eligibility: Women, SC/ST, small/marginal farmers in Maharashtra

name: Millet Mission & Kiwi/Dragon Fruit Policy (Uttarakhand)
description: Horticulture initiative supporting millets and high‑value fruit cultivation in hill districts.
amount: Budgets of ₹134‑894 crore for multiple missions
benefits: Boosts horticultural income in Uttarakhand.

name: Rythu Bandhu Scheme (Telangana)
description: Investment support scheme providing ₹5,000 per acre per season directly to farmer landowners.
benefits: Direct agricultural investment support.

name: Tamil Nadu Irrigated Agriculture Modernization Project (TNIAMP)
description: A World Bank assisted project to upgrade irrigated agriculture including precision farming, water‑saving technologies and crop diversification.
benefits: Increases yields via drip-fertigation and precision farming demonstration.
eligibility: Participating via local agriculture extension units

name: Tamil Nadu Agricultural Mechanisation Programme
description: Subsidy scheme for procurement of farm machinery such as tractors, power tillers, paddy transplanters and reapers.
amount: 25% subsidy or GoI ceiling, whichever lower
benefits: Reduces manual labour, increases efficiency.

name: Minor Irrigation Scheme (Tamil Nadu)
description: Supports community-based water harvesting: drip irrigation, farm ponds, check dams and borewells.
amount: 100% grant for WUAs; 90% subsidy to farmers
benefits: Improves groundwater recharge and farm water reliability.

name: Kudimaramathu Scheme
description: Community‑based rejuvenation of tanks and lakes, dredging silt and strengthening embankments with farmer participation.
amount: State budget allocation per year (~₹100‑300 crore)
benefits: Enhances groundwater levels, provides nutrient soil residue to farmers.

name: Uzhavar Sandhai (Farmers' Market)
description: State-run farmers’ market promoting direct sale of produce to consumers without intermediaries.
amount: No direct payout; market infrastructure support
benefits: Better price discovery and reduced middlemen.

name: RKVY‑RAFTAAR (TN Agri‑Startups)
description: Tamil Nadu Agricultural University supported grants to agri‑startups under RKVY-RAFTAAR mission.
benefits: Encourages innovation, agri‑technology solutions led by startups.

name: Integrated Pest Management (Tamil Nadu)
description: Promotes eco‑friendly pest control practices via subsidies, training and extension services.
benefits: Ensures low pesticide residue and sustainable pest management.
eligibility: Fruit and vegetable growers in TN

name: Kalaignar All‑Village Integrated Agricultural Development Programme
description: Government‑funded initiative for farm mechanization and infrastructure across all villages.
amount: Subsidies for power tillers, weeders, transplanters etc.
benefits: Improves mechanization access for marginal farmers.
eligibility: Small and marginal farmers across TN
Managed via district Farmer Welfare Centres

name: Krishi Samruddhi Yojana (Maharashtra)
description: State‑level agriculture uplift programme with ₹5,000 crore annual investment to support infrastructure, innovation & DBT subsidies.
benefits: Boosts modern farming practices, credit, infrastructure via DBT.

name: Raitha Bhagya Scheme (Karnataka)
description: Income support programme for Karnataka farmers independent of landholding size.
benefits: Direct income assistance to farmers.
eligibility: Farmers registered in state DBT portal

name: Krishi Bhagya Scheme (Karnataka)
description: Subsidy for micro-irrigation to promote drip and sprinkler systems in farming.
benefits: Improved water use efficiency and crop productivity.

name: Rythu Bandhu Scheme (Telangana)
description: Investment support scheme offering ₹10,000/year directly to land-owning farmers.
benefits: Supports crop investment for two seasons.

name: Haryana Fasal Suraksha Yojana
description: State-backed crop insurance scheme supplementing PMFBY to cover yield losses.
benefits: Additional crop insurance support to local growers.
eligibility: Registered farmers under PMFBY in Haryana

name: National Food Security Mission (Assam)
description: Assam branch of NFSM providing inputs and support for paddy, pulses and cereals.
benefits: Enhances grain productivity and food security.
eligibility: Farmers growing target crops in Assam

name: Krishonnati Yojana (Andhra Pradesh)
description: State‑level agricultural growth programme focused on modernization and input support.
benefits: Boosts innovation, mechanization, & sustainable farming.
eligibility: Farmers and FPOs in Andhra Pradesh

name: Nanaji Deshmukh Krishi Sanjivani Yojana (Maharashtra)
description: Drought-prone area rehabilitation scheme funded via a World Bank loan (~₹28,000 crore) to ensure sustainable cropping.
benefits: Revives drought‑prone areas for resilient farming.

name: Raitha Bhagya Scheme (Karnataka)
description: Provides universal income support to Karnataka farmers regardless of landholding size.
benefits: Regular cash support to registered farmers.
eligibility: Registered farmers via Karnataka DBT portal

name: Krishi Bhagya (Karnataka) – Drip Irrigation
description: Micro-irrigation subsidy scheme providing drip and sprinkler systems to farmers.
benefits: Enhances water-use efficiency and crop yields.
eligibility: Registered farmers applying via Horticulture Dept.

name: Customized Hiring Service Centre – Krishi Yantra Dhare (Karnataka)
description: Rental service for farm machinery to make equipment accessible at affordable rates.
benefits: Access to high-cost implements for small farmers.

name: Karnataka Raita Suraksha – PMFBY State Variant
description: State-level crop insurance that supplements PMFBY to provide broader coverage.
benefits: Improved crop insurance benefits to farmers.
eligibility: Farmers registered under PMFBY in Karnataka

name: Unified Market Platform (UMP) – Karnataka
description: Digital trading system (ReMS) connecting farmers and buyers across state-run markets.
benefits: Higher price realization through transparent trade.

name: Karnataka NABARD Carbon Credit Pilot
description: Pilot scheme encouraging biomass/tree plantation among farmers with carbon credit generation.
benefits: Additional income from environmental services.
eligibility: Mango farmers in affected districts (e.g. Koppal)

name: Tamil Nadu IAMWARM Project
description: World Bank-assisted scheme for modernizing irrigated agriculture with water-saving tech and crop diversification.
benefits: Boosts productivity through efficient irrigation.

name: TN Agricultural Mechanisation Programme
description: State subsidy programme for farm machinery including tractors, tillers, transplanters.
benefits: Improves productivity and reduces labour demand.

name: Minor Irrigation Scheme (Tamil Nadu)
description: Support for farm ponds, check dams & community borewells with high subsidy rates.
benefits: Sustainable farm water management.

name: Uzhavar Sandhai (Farmers’ Market, TN)
description: Direct sale platform allowing farmers to sell produce directly to consumers.
benefits: Eliminates middlemen, improves farmer margin.

name: Integrated Pest Management (Tamil Nadu)
description: Eco-friendly pest control through input subsidy and farmer training programs.
amount: Input subsidy plus training cost coverage
benefits: Safe pest management and residue reduction.

name: NFSM – National Food Security Mission (Assam)
description: State branch of NFSM providing input subsidy to target crops (rice, pulses etc.) in Assam.
benefits: Boosts food crop productivity.
eligibility: Farmers growing NFSM crops in Assam

name: Krishonnati Yojana (Andhra Pradesh)
description: State agricultural modernization project for infrastructural development and innovation support.
benefits: Enables modern farming through infrastructure support.

name: Haryana Fasal Suraksha Yojana
description: State-level crop insurance scheme building upon PMFBY to provide additional protection.
benefits: Additional insurance benefit for Haryana farmers.

name: Minimum Floor Price Scheme (Uttar Pradesh)
description: Price support for perishables like tomato, onion, potato via government procurement.
benefits: Prevents distress sale of perishables.
eligibility: Farmers of perishable crops in UP
